name: Radial wipe spinner
description:
A technique for creating those spinners that "wax on" and then "wax off" ðŸ¤“


Right now, Smart Animate just dissolves between circles with different arc settings and such. Rotation of layers (including masks), however, does work, so that's what this workaround uses to achieve the same effect.


A few pointers:


  • The mask shapes need to be inside of frames that are square, since they'll always rotate around the center.
  • At a couple points, you need to use -180Â°. To do that, type in -179.9999...if you just type in -180, it'll convert it from negative to positive and ruin the rotation direction.


If Figma adds support for animating the transitions between arcs, this won't be needed anymore. For now, though, it's a pretty flexible workaround.


Leave a comment if you remix it into something cool!
